alert.note: Alert for Dunklin (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 03 at 8:16PM CST until January 05 at 12:00AM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Arkansas...Missouri... Saint Francis River near Saint Francis For the Saint Francis River...including Saint Francis, Lake City, Madison...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Saint Francis River near Saint Francis. * WHEN...Until early Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 22.0 feet, Several roads near Wilhelmina, Missouri are flooded. Recreational areas and large areas of agricultural land near the river are flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM CST Monday the stage was 22.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:00 PM CST Monday was 23.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight and continue falling to 18.8 feet Saturday evening. - Flood stage is 22.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 22.4 feet on 01/14/2005. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at weather.gov/memphis. The next statement will be issued as conditions warrant.
